detaileddescription.para: Set the frontend specification.
Get the frontend specification.
Return the number of motherboards in this configuration.
Set the sample rate for this connection to the USRP.
Get the sample rate for this connection to the USRP. This is the actual sample rate and may differ from the rate set.
Get the possible sample rates for this connection.

simplesect.para: a range of rates in Sps

detaileddescription.para: Tune the selected channel to the desired center frequency.

simplesect.para: a tune result with the actual frequencies

detaileddescription.para: Tune the the selected channel to the desired center frequency.
This is a wrapper around set_center_freq() so that in this case, the user can pass a single frequency in the call instead of having to generate a tune_request_t object.

simplesect.para: a tune result with the actual frequencies

detaileddescription.para: Get the center frequency.
Get the tunable frequency range.
Set the gain for the selected channel.
Set the named gain on the dboard.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the gain stage

detaileddescription.para: Set the normalized gain.

The normalized gain is always in [0, 1], regardless of the device. 0 corresponds to minimum gain (usually 0 dB, but make sure to read the device notes in the UHD manual) and 1 corresponds to maximum gain. This will work for any UHD device. Use get_gain() to see which dB value the normalized gain value corresponds to.
Note that it is not possible to specify a gain name for this function.

parameterdescription.para: runtime_error if norm_gain is not within the valid range.
the gain in fractions of the gain range (must be 0 <= norm_gain <= 1)

detaileddescription.para: Get the actual dboard gain setting.
Get the actual dboard gain setting of named stage.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the gain stage

detaileddescription.para: Returns the normalized gain.
The normalized gain is always in [0, 1], regardless of the device. See also set_normalized_gain().
Note that it is not possible to specify a gain name for this function, the result is over the entire gain chain.
Get the actual dboard gain setting of named stage.
Get the settable gain range.
Get the settable gain range.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the gain stage

Get a list of possible antennas on a given channel.

detaileddescription.para: Get the bandpass filter range of the RF frontend.

Set the time at which the control commands will take effect.

A timed command will back-pressure all subsequent timed commands, assuming that the subsequent commands occur within the time-window. If the time spec is late, the command will be activated upon arrival.

parameterdescription.para: the time at which the next command will activate
which motherboard to set the config

detaileddescription.para: Clear the command time so future commands are sent ASAP.

parameterdescription.para: which motherboard to set the config

parameterdescription.para: which motherboard to set the user register

detaileddescription.para: Set the clock configuration.

DEPRECATED for set_time/clock_source.
clock_config
the new configuration
mboard
the motherboard index 0 to M-1
Set the time source for the USRP device.

This sets the method of time synchronization, typically a pulse per second or an encoded time. Typical options for source: external, MIMO.
source
a string representing the time source
mboard
which motherboard to set the config
Update the stream args for this device.

This update will only take effect after a restart of the streaming, or before streaming and after construction. This will also delete the current streamer. Note you cannot change the I/O signature of this block using this function, or it will throw.
It is possible to leave the 'channels' fields of stream_args unset. In this case, the previous channels field is used.

Enumerate GPIO banks on the current device.
mboard
the motherboard index 0 to M-1
a list of string for each bank name

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &bank, const std::string &attr, const boost::uint32_t value, const boost::uint32_t mask=0xffffffff, const size_t mboard=0)=0
memberdef.name: set_gpio_attr

detaileddescription.para:
Set a GPIO attribute on a particular GPIO bank. Possible attribute names:
CTRL - 1 for ATR mode 0 for GPIO mode
DDR - 1 for output 0 for input
OUT - GPIO output level (not ATR mode)
ATR_0X - ATR idle state
ATR_RX - ATR receive only state
ATR_TX - ATR transmit only state
ATR_XX - ATR full duplex state
bank
the name of a GPIO bank
attr
the name of a GPIO attribute
value
the new value for this GPIO bank
mask
the bit mask to effect which pins are changed
mboard
the motherboard index 0 to M-1

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &bank, const std::string &attr, const size_t mboard=0)=0
memberdef.name: get_gpio_attr

detaileddescription.para:
Get a GPIO attribute on a particular GPIO bank. Possible attribute names:
CTRL - 1 for ATR mode 0 for GPIO mode
DDR - 1 for output 0 for input
OUT - GPIO output level (not ATR mode)
ATR_0X - ATR idle state
ATR_RX - ATR receive only state
ATR_TX - ATR transmit only state
ATR_XX - ATR full duplex state
READBACK - readback input GPIOs
bank
the name of a GPIO bank
attr
the name of a GPIO attribute
mboard
the motherboard index 0 to M-1
the value set for this attribute
Base class for USRP blocks.

Note that many of the functions defined here differ between Rx and Tx configurations. As an example, set_center_freq() will set the Rx frequency for a usrp_source object, and the Tx frequency on a usrp_sink object.
